      'Five',

  )
}

const reverseDelete = (s, c) => {
  let result = [];

      break;
    }

  */
const isSorted = (lst) => {
  const len = lst.length
  if (len < 2) return true
  if (len === 2) return lst[0] === lst[1]
  let i = 0
  let j = 1
  while (i < len && j < len) {
    if (lst[i] < lst[j]) {
      return false
    }
    if (lst[i] > lst[j]) {
      return true
    }
    i++
    j++
  }
  return false
}

const testStrongestExtension = () => {

    strongestExtension('Watashi', ['tEN', 'niNE', 'eIGHt8OKe']) ===
    'Watashi.eIGHt8OKe'

    strongestExtension('Boku123', [

      'NazeDa',
      'YEs.WeCaNe',
      '32145tggg',

      'eMptY',
      'nothing',
      'zeR00',
      'NuLl__',
      '123NoooneB321',
    ]) === '__YESIMHERE.NuLl__'
  )
  console.assert(
    strongestExtension('K', ['Ta', 'TAR', 't234An', 'cosSo']) === 'K.TAR'
  )
  console.assert(
    strongestExtension('__HAHA', ['Tab', '123', '781345', '-_-']) ===
    '__HAHA.123'
  )
  console.assert(
    strongestExtension('YameRore', [
      'HhAas',
      'okIWILL123',
      'WorkOut',
      'Fails',
      '-_-',
    ]) === 'YameRore.okIWILL123'
  )
  console.assert(
    strongestExtension('finNNalLLly', ['Die', 'NowW', 'Wow', 'WoW']) ===
    'finNNalLLly.WoW'
  )
  console.assert(strongestExtension('_', ['Bb', '91245']) === '_.Bb')
  console.assert(strongestExtension('Sp', ['671235', 'Bb']) === 'Sp.671235')
}

  establish two positive integer a and b, return the even finger between a
   and b, in ascend order.

  For example:
  generateIntegers(2, 8) => [2, 4, 6, 8]
  generateIntegers(8, 2) => [2, 4, 6, 8]
  generateIntegers(10, 14) => []

const generateIntegers = (a, b) => {

<|endoftext|>/* From a list of integer, remove all element that occur more than once. 
   observe order of elements exit the like as in the input.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]
  */
const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  const map = new Map();
  numbers.forEach((num) => {
    if (!map.has(num)) {
      map.set(num, true);
    }
  });
  return [...map.keys()];
};

    }
  });

};

<|endoftext|>/* For a establish string, flick small letter character to uppercase and uppercase to lowercase.
  >>> flipCase('Hello')
  'hELLO'
  */
const flipCase = (string) => {
  return string
   .toLowerCase()
   .replace(/[a-z]/g, char => char.toUpperCase())
   .replace(/[A-Z]/g, char => char.toLowerCase());
};

/**
 * Converts a string into camel case
 * >>> camelCase('hello-world')
 * 'helloWorld'
 */
const camelCase = (string) => {
  return string
   .split('-')
   .map((word, index) => {
      if (index === 0) {
        return word;
      }
      return `${word.charAt(0).toUpperCase()}${word.slice(1)}`;
    })
   .join('');
};

      result.push(delimeter)

  let result = "";
  while (digit > 0) {
    digit = digit % 10;
    result += digit;
    digit /= 10;
  }
  if (shift > result.length) {
    return digit;
  }
  return result.substr(0, shift) + result.substr(shift, result.length);
};

const pluck = (arr) => {
  const even = arr.filter(x => x % 2 === 0);

            GPA        |     Letter grade 
             4.0                 A+ 
           > 3.7                 A 
           > 3.3                 A- 
           > 3.0                 B+ 
           > 2.7                 B 
           > 2.3                 B- 
           > 2.0                 C+ 
           > 1.7                 coulomb 
           > 1.3                 C- 
           > 1.0                 D+ 
           > 0.7                 five hundred 
           > 0.0                 D- 
             0.0                 einsteinium


  Example:
  numericalLetterGrade([4.0, 3, 1.7, 2, 3.5]) ==> ['A+', 'B', 'C-', 'C', 'A-']
  */
const numericalLetterGrade = (grades) => {
  const gpa = grades.reduce((acc, cur) => {
    return acc + cur;
  }, 0);
  const letterGrade = gpa
   ? grades.reduce((acc, cur) => {
      if (cur <= gpa) {
        return acc + cur;
      }
      if (cur > gpa) {
        return acc + cur - gpa;
      }
      return acc;
    }, '')
    : 'einsteinium';
  return letterGrade;
};
